amendment.description: To increase funding to combat avian flu, increase local preparedness, and create a Manhattan Project-like effort to develop a vaccine to inoculate the U.S. Population against a pandemic by $5 billion in FY 2007 paid for by requiring tax withholding on government payments to contractors like Halliburton.

vote.text: Amendment SA 3133 not agreed to in Senate by Yea-Nay Vote. 44 - 55. Record Vote Number: 55.

action.text: Amendment SA 3133 proposed by Senator Conrad. (consideration: CR S2226-2227, S2241; text: CR S2226-2227) To increase funding to combat avian flu, increase local preparedness, and create a Manhattan Project-like effort to develop a vaccine to inoculate the U.S. Population against a pandemic by $5 billion in FY 2007 paid for by requiring tax withholding on government payments to contractors like Halliburton.
Senate amendment proposed (on the floor): Amendment SA 3133 proposed by Senator Conrad.
Roll call votes on amendments in Senate: Amendment SA 3133 not agreed to in Senate by Yea-Nay Vote. 44 - 55. Record Vote Number: 55.
Senate amendment not agreed to: Amendment SA 3133 not agreed to in Senate by Yea-Nay Vote. 44 - 55. Record Vote Number: 55.
